Articles.Content:
I noticed that in-game, KOS can't save scripts and cannot see those that I wrote while the game was running. 

IS IT NORMAL?  Am I forced to restart KSP?

On 1/11/2020 at 1:17 PM, RickyOri said:

 I noticed that in-game, KOS can't save scripts and cannot see those that I wrote while the game was running. 

IS IT NORMAL?  Am I forced to restart KSP?

Works fine for me, but I don't usually use the in-game text editor.  Are you familiar with the different storage volumes for scripts?

I tend to test stuff by pasting it in to the editor and saving it and not had any issues.  Are you sure you've got enough storage space left on your kOS module?  I've run in to that issue too many times to mention, and have now started compiling my scripts before putting them on the ship which saves a lot of space.

Also backing up Jonny's comment above, if you're editing and saving the script on the ship (volume 1), you'll lose it if you revert/reload/recover that ship.  I do everything in Notepad++ in my /ships/scripts folder (volume 0), and then have a boot script that copies them to the ship on loading.

Edited January 14, 2020 by RizzoTheRat
